column2: Planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030
column5: The implementation of TA6.47 is likely to have a positive impact on TA2.38, as the increased tree cover can contribute to carbon sequestration and help achieve the EU's offshore wind and renewable energy targets.

column2: Achieving an increasing trend at national level of at least six out of seven indicators in forest ecosystems
column5: The implementation of TA6.48 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.8, as the improvement in forest ecosystem indicators can lead to increased recycling and reuse of materials, contributing to a more circular economy.

column2: Achieving an increasing trend in the common forest bird index
column5: The implementation of TA6.49 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.4, as the improvement in forest bird populations can indicate a healthier ecosystem, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems and the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Reach no net land take
column5: The implementation of TA6.50 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.9, as reducing land take can help achieve a more circular economy by reducing waste and promoting the recycling of materials.

column2: Ensuring water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean
column5: The implementation of TA6.51 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.6, as improving water quality can contribute to reducing pollution and promoting a healthier environment, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: Reducing air pollution
column5: The implementation of TA6.52 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.9, as reducing air pollution can contribute to improving air quality, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems and the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Reducing waste, plastic litter at sea
column5: The implementation of TA6.62 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.10, as reducing waste and plastic litter can contribute to improving the health of marine ecosystems, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: The Industrial Emissions Directive aims to prevent or reduce emissions from large industrial installations
column5: The implementation of TA7.4 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.47, as reducing industrial emissions can contribute to improving air quality, which can in turn support the development of forest ecosystems and the achievement of tree planting targets.

column2: The revised Urban Wastewater Treatment Directive extends the scope of the 1991 UWWTD
column5: The implementation of TA7.5 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.51, as improving wastewater treatment can contribute to reducing pollution and promoting a healthier environment, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing chemical pesticides' use by 50%
column5: The implementation of TA7.6 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.48, as reducing chemical pesticides can contribute to improving soil health, which can in turn support the development of forest ecosystems and the achievement of indicators for forest ecosystem health.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses use by 50%
column5: The implementation of TA7.8 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.50, as reducing nutrient losses can contribute to improving soil health, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems and the reduction of land take.

column2: Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55%
column5: The implementation of TA7.9 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.52, as improving air quality can contribute to reducing pollution and promoting a healthier environment, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%)
column5: The implementation of TA7.10 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.62, as reducing waste and plastic litter can contribute to improving the health of marine ecosystems, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column5: The implementation of TA7.11 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.51, as reducing microplastics can contribute to improving water quality, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity
column5: The implementation of TA7.13 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.48, as reducing air pollution can contribute to improving ecosystem health, which can in turn support the development of forest ecosystems and the achievement of indicators for forest ecosystem health.

column2: Reduce the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise by 30%, by 2030
column5: The implementation of TA7.14 is likely to have a negative impact on TA3.9, as reducing transport noise can lead to increased transportation activity, which can in turn increase energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Having all soils in healthy condition by 2050
column5: The implementation of TA7.15 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.50, as achieving healthy soil conditions can contribute to reducing land take and promoting sustainable land use.

column2: By means of an updated and harmonised list of pollutants affecting surface and groundwater
column5: The implementation of TA7.16 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.51, as improving water quality can contribute to reducing pollution and promoting a healthier environment, which can in turn support the development of industrial ecosystems.

column2: Cumulative EU offshore goals of installed capacity: 60 GW by 2030 and 300 GW by 2050
column5: The implementation of TA2.38 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.47, as increasing offshore wind capacity can contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting sustainable land use, which can in turn support the development of forest ecosystems.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050
column5: The implementation of TA2.39 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.4, as increasing ocean energy capacity can contribute to reducing industrial emissions and promoting a more circular economy.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonised on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: The implementation of TA2.40 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.9, as decarbonising steel production can contribute to improving air quality and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Halve the amount of residual municipal waste by 2030
column5: The implementation of TA3.1 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.50, as reducing waste can contribute to reducing land take and promoting sustainable land use.

column2: Double EU’s circular material use rate in the coming decade
column5: The implementation of TA3.3 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.6, as increasing circular material use can contribute to reducing chemical pesticides and promoting a more circular economy.

column2: By 2030, Union extraction capacity should be able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.8 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.4, as increasing extraction capacity can contribute to reducing industrial emissions and promoting a more circular economy.

column2: By 2030, Union processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, should be able to produce at least 40% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.9 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.5, as increasing processing capacity can contribute to improving wastewater treatment and promoting a more circular economy.

column2: Diversify the Union’s imports of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.11 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.16, as diversifying imports can contribute to improving water quality and reducing pollution.

column2: Manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs
column5: The implementation of TA3.12 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.9, as increasing manufacturing capacity can contribute to improving air quality and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: By 2030, Union recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, should be able to produce at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.13 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.6, as increasing recycling capacity can contribute to reducing chemical pesticides and promoting a more circular economy.

column2: Producers of starting, lighting and ignition batteries shall take back free of charge and without an obligation on the end-user to buy a new battery
column5: The implementation of TA3.15 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.11, as increasing battery recycling can contribute to reducing microplastics and promoting a more circular economy.

column5: The implementation of TA3.16 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.11, as increasing battery collection can contribute to reducing microplastics and promoting a more circular economy.

column5: The implementation of TA3.18 is likely to have a positive impact on TA7.9, as increasing battery recycling can contribute to improving air quality and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
